iti82:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti82:2.1: “Mendicants, these three cries are uttered among the gods on occasion.
iti82:2.3: When a noble disciple shaves off their hair and beard, dresses in ocher robes, and goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, the gods cry out:
iti82:2.4: ‘This noble disciple intends to join battle with Māra!’
iti82:2.5: This is the first occasion a cry is uttered among the gods.
iti82:3.1: Furthermore, when a noble disciple meditates pursuing the development of the seven qualities that lead to awakening, the gods cry out:
iti82:3.2: ‘This noble disciple is joining battle with Māra!’
